I've played this game for a day now, which in retrospect isn't long at all considering the players that have put thousands of hours into this game, but i'd like to review Dead by Daylight from a beginners point of view due to the amount of people that have just joined the community through the steam summer sale.

Here are the pros:
Its an original experience that few games can provide.
Its graphics are pretty decent.
Tricking killers and looping them is fun and keeps the game pretty fresh.
Finally killing that one annoying survivor makes playing killer worth it.
Playing mind games with killers/survivors is pretty damn fun.
Not pay to win
Big booty Jane exists

Here are the cons:
BUGS...so...much...bugs...
Hitboxes are pretty broken, hits that look miles away somehow hit and I bet its due to us not having dedicated servers yet.
Peer to peer is awful.
Killers hosting the games leads to lag switching.
Did I mention we should have dedicated servers yet?
Legion exists.

Overall id say Dead by Daylight was worth the sale price, but I cant say the same with all DLC included if you're like me who doesnt want to play every killer or survivor, buy the DLC with the killers/survivors you want then move on because the other DLC wont be of much use to you if you never use the killer/survivor.

The devs genuinely have one singular collective brain cell. 

The only reason I have so many hours played is because the game is grindy af and the devs won't do anything about it.
